12.05 GMT Burnham: Michael Gove 's after 50 new powers. Photograph: Christopher Thomond for the Guardian As MPs gear up for the second reading of the education bill in parliament today, the shadow education secretary `` Michael Gove will ask MPs to give him more than 50 new powers to control almost every single aspect of the school system in England. The education secretary wants to tell children what subjects they should study, teachers what and how they should teach and local communities what kind of schools they must have. Despite his support for Barack Obama , Colin Powell would make no commitment yet for the 2012 White House race.`` I will always vote for the person who I think is best qualified,'' he said. I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates. I have not yet seen anybody on the Republican side that I am ready to commit to and I am not committed to Barack Obama either.
